verbs.description: propagandize (third-person singular simple present propagandizes, present participle propagandizing, simple past and past participle propagandized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To tell propaganda to someone in an attempt to influence one's views.
examples: After we'd managed to make ourselves comfortable in this garret, my new friends began to propagandize me. All they knew about me was that I was a student  […]

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use something or someone in propaganda purposes.
examples: He propagandized this panacea with single-minded determination throughout the revolutionary period and even managed to establish a People's Bank for a short time before his arrest in 1849.
